title: Summary of Secondary Optical Peaks in Twisted MoTe2
description: A summary and analysis of 'secondary peaks' observed in the optical spectra (PL and dR/R) of twisted MoTe2 devices (D10 and JCD13). The study investigates the behavior of these emergent excitonic features, which appear in addition to the main trion resonance, as a function of carrier density (n), displacement field (D), magnetic field, temperature, and laser power. Key findings include the emergence of a higher-energy exciton peak at integer filling v=1 at a critical D-field, energy splitting of ~3.5-4.5 meV from the trion, and strong dependencies on magnetic field, temperature, and power, providing insights into the correlated electronic states of the system.

dRR vs n, D=0.04, 6T
R
L
Large field check. Basically, what I want to show here is that the lack of RMCD signal between the tails (ex, at n=-0.6E13, dashed line, and Deff=0) is from lack of FM order, rather than a lack of sensitivity to FM order because there are no states to sense the order.  Though it does seem like the dRR resonance beyond v=-1 (ex at n=-0.6E13) is much less sharp, it still does appear to have polarization dependence at sufficiently high field.  Basically, assuming that the RL difference in this measurement is due to the large field aligning the spins, it appears that we do have sensitivity to magnetic order in this region, as sensed by the polarization dependence of the reflectance, and that the lack of RMCD signal between the tails is from the lack of FM order, instead of the lack of sensitivity
